eu.geclipse.core.auth
Class CaCertManager

java.lang.Object
  eu.geclipse.core.auth.CaCertManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.compare.IContentChangeNotifier
public class CaCertManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.eclipse.compare.IContentChangeNotifier

This class manages all CA certificates that are currently loaded in the workspace. It also provides methods for retrieving new certificates from local or remote repositories. The getCaCertLocation() method can be used to initialise external packages like the org.globus.

Method Detail

getManager

public static CaCertManager getManager()
This methods can be used to get a CaCertManager. If no manager was yet requested the singleton is instantiated once.

Returns:
The singleton.

addCertificate

public void addCertificate(ICaCertificate certificate)
Add a certificate to the list of managed certificates.

Parameters:
certificate - The cterificate to be added.

addCertificates

public void addCertificates(ICaCertificate[] certificates)
Add a list of certificates to the managed certificates.

Parameters:
certificates - The certifcates to be added.

getCertificates

public ICaCertificate[] getCertificates()
Get a copy of the internal list of all currently managed certificates.

Returns:
A list containing all currently available certificates.

getCertificate

public ICaCertificate getCertificate(java.lang.String id)
Get the certificate with the specified ID or null if not found.

Parameters:
id - The unique ID of the certificate.
Returns:
The certificate with the specified ID or null if no such certificate was found.

deleteCertificate

public void deleteCertificate(java.lang.String id)
Deletes the certificate with the specified id from the manager. Deleting a certificate means also deleting the corresponding file from disk. If the certificate is once deleted it should not longer be referenced or used outside the CaCertManager.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the certificate that should be deleted. If no such certificate was found nothing will be done.

deleteCertificates

public void deleteCertificates(java.lang.String[] ids)
Delete the certificates with the specified ids. The certificates are removed from the list of certificates and are deleted afterwards.

Parameters:
ids - The ids of the certificates to be deleted.

getCaCertLocation

public org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath getCaCertLocation()
Get the path to the location where the certificates are stored. This method can be used for instance to initialise the CoG-jglobus with CoGProperties.setCaCertLocations(String).

Returns:
An absolute IPath that describes the location of the certificates in the filesystem.
